results.title: Jeanne Dielman, 23, Quai du Commerce 1080 Bruxelles
results.creator_credit: Paradise Films, Unité Trois, Ministère de la Culture Française de Belgique, Chantal Akerman, Paul Vecchiali, Liliane de Kermadec, Alain Dahan and Guy Cavagnac
results.brief_description: A lonely widowed housewife does her daily chores, takes care of her apartment where she lives with her teenage son, and turns the occasional trick to make ends meet. Slowly, her ritualized daily routines begin to fall apart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paradise Films, Unité Trois, Ministère de la Culture Française de Belgique, Chantal Akerman, Paul Vecchiali, Liliane de Kermadec, Alain Dahan and Guy Cavagnac

results.title: Jeanette Powell
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: In 1996 Powell became the first female to represent The Nationals in the Victorian Government when she was elected as the Member for the North Eastern Province in the Legislative Council. Powell’s political career began as a Councillor for the Shire of Shepparton. Powell has served as Shepparton Shire President, was appointed a commissioner with the Shire of Campaspe in 1994 and in 2002 Powell was elected as the State Member for Shepparton District. Powell is currently the Shadow Minister for Local Government and the Shadow Minister for Aboriginal Affairs.

results.title: Jean Mitry Compilation
results.brief_description: En Bateau A visual interpretation of 3 piano compositions by Claude Debussy, “En Bateau”, “Movements” and “Clouchies a Travers Les Feuilles”. “Images Pour Debussy” Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau” and “Arabesques”. “Pacific 231” Arthur Honnegar’s visual interpretation of a symphonic poem. “Reverie De Claude Debussy” Four piano works by Debussy: “Movements”, “Cloches a Travers Les Feuilles”, “Reverie” and “Claire de Lune”.
results.description: En Bateau A visual interpretation of 3 piano compositions by Claude Debussy, “En Bateau”, “Movements” and “Clouchies a Travers Les Feuilles”. “Images Pour Debussy” Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau” and “Arabesques”. “Pacific 231” Arthur Honnegar’s visual interpretation of a symphonic poem. “Reverie De Claude Debussy” Four piano works by Debussy: “Movements”, “Cloches a Travers Les Feuilles”, “Reverie” and “Claire de Lune”.

results.title: Jean Francois Millet
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Discusses the works of Jean Francois Millet, whose subjects were intensely Romantic, but whose treatment of the human figure was entirely Classical. His early work is almost a total negation of his later achievement.

results.title: Jean de Florette
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Lavish film version of Marcel Pagnol’s tale of a simple man who leaves the city to live on an inherited piece of land but is ruined when he fails to find water to irrigate his property because the location of an underground spring is kept secret from him by two scheming villagers who wish to take over the farm. The conclusion to this story comes in the sequel, “Manon des Sources”. “Jean de Florette” stars Yves Montand and Gerard Depardieu.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions

results.title: Jean Cocteau: Autoportrait D'un Inconnu
results.brief_description:
In this ‘first person’ documentary, Edgardo Cozarinsky uses a long interview with Cocteau who recounts the intellectual life in Paris at the turn of the XXth Century, as well that the birth of the ‘Avant-guarde’ movement with ‘Les ballet Russes’ and the uproar that accompanied the staging of ‘Parade’.

Credits: Producer, Carole Weisweiller ; director, Edgardo Cozarinsky ; writers, Edgardo Cozarinsky, Carole Weisweiller.

results.title: Jean-Pierre Melville Cineaste
results.brief_description:
This short film follows Jean-Pierre Melville during the filming of ‘The Shadow Army’. Melville explains his interest in WWII which stems from his involvement in the Resistance movement and later on led to his filming an adaptation of ‘Le Silence de la Mer’. He confides his fascination for American cinema where action matters first and foremost.

Credits: Director, Jacques Dupont.

results.title: Jean-Auguste Dominique Ingres. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Ingres was a pure artist, a believer in art for art’s sake. Like Degas, he was obsessed with an ideal of perfect form to which he gave his whole life, but succeeded in capturing it only when the subject was the female nude. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Jean-Auguste Dominique Ingres. No. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Examines Ingres’ reputation as the archetypal Classic artist and finds it misleading. Ingres escaped completely from orthodox classicism by making direct studies of Greek vases rather than by copying established interpreters. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.
